paper_title.en: Performance improvement of induction motor speed sensor-less vector control system using an adaptive observer with an estimated flux feedback in low speed range
paper_title.ja: 推定磁束のフィードバックをもつ適応オブザーバによる誘導電動機速度センサレスベクトル制御の低速運転性能の改善

description.en: Because of various errors caused by dead time, temperature variation of resistance and so on, the speed estimation error is inevitable in the speed sensor-less vector control methods of the induction motor. Especially, the speed control loop becomes unstable at near zero frequency. In order to solve these problems, this paper proposes a novel design of an adaptive observer for the speed estimation. Adding a feedback loop of the error between the estimated and reference fluxes, the sensitivity of the current error signals for the speed estimation and the primary resistance identification are improved. The proposed system is analyzed and the appropriate feedback gains are derived. The experimental results showed good performance in low speed range. © 2008 The Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan.

paper_title.en: Performance improvement of induction motor speed sensor-less vector control system by the phase current non-zero control in low speed range
paper_title.ja: 相電流非ゼロ制御を用いた誘導電動機速度センサレスベクトル制御の極低速運転の性能改善

description.en: A lot of researches about speed sensor-less vector control methods of the IM have been published and applied to practical systems. However, because of various errors caused by dead time, temperature variation of resistance and so on, the speed estimation error is inevitable in the practical applications. The inverter voltage control error is very sensitive to phase current near zero cross. Therefore, the speed estimation becomes unstable when the phase current zero cross and the zero frequency condition occur simultaneously. In order to solve these problems, this paper proposes a novel method to reduce the inverter voltage control error. The phase current references are forbidden to stay near zero, where the voltage control error is very sensitive to the phase current. The phase current non-zero control causes the harmonics which influences the speed estimation. The harmonics is compensated appropriately by a novel method, which cancels the harmonic component in the input signals to the speed estimator. The experimental results with phase current non-zero control showed good performance in low speed range. © 2008 The Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan.

paper_title.ja: 圧縮機用PMSM位置センサレスベクトル制御のためのBPFを用いた周期的速度変動抑制制御
paper_title.en: Reduction of Cyclic Speed Change Using a Band-Pass Filter for Compressor PMSM Sine-Wave Position Sensor-Less Drives

description.ja: 同一次元オブザーバを用いた速度・位置センサレス制御において、圧縮機のトルク変動により発生する周期的な速度変動をバンドパスフィルタを用いて抽出し、等価微分によって位相を90度進めて電動機のトルクを制御することにより、従来困難であった速度変動を大幅に低減し、機械的振動および騒音を低減した。
description.en: Position sensor-less vector control is applied to a compressor drive system using an IPMSM to realize higher efficiency. In this paper, a reduction control of cyclic speed change is proposed to achieve the high performance, such as low vibration and low acoustic noise. Designing a speed estimator using an adaptive observer with a wide frequency band, fundamental frequency component of the cyclic speed change is calculated by a band-pass filter. The proposed compensation method recognizing the fundamental component can reduce the cyclic speed change to acceptable level. Principle of the compensation method is presented as well as experimental results.

publisher.ja: The Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan
publisher.en: The Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan

paper_title.en: A method for calculating AC currents from sampled DC current data in a three-phase PWM inverter
paper_title.ja: 三相PWMインバータの直流電流検出による交流電流演算の一手法

description.ja: 家電製品などに用いられるPMモータの位置・速度センサレス制御では、交流電流センサも低価格化の妨げとなる。本研究では、直流側のシャント抵抗の電圧から交流電流波形を算出する方法を提案した。特に、モータの電機子インダクタンスが小さい場合に問題となる交流電流波形の脈動成分による誤差を補正する方法を提案している。
description.en: In order to reduce costs of inverters for home electrical appliances using the PMSM, the AC current sensor-less control is required as well as the position sensor-less control. This paper proposes a PWM technique suitable for calculating AC currents from sampled DC current data in the one-shunt system, which is one of the AC current sensor-less methods. The proposed PWM technique using a triangle carrier wave leads to the dc current sampling at near the top and bottom of the carrier wave, and AC current calculation within one cycle of the carrier under normal conditions. To reduce errors in the AC current calculation caused by the PWM current ripple, the current ripple waveforms are calculated from the instantaneous inverter output voltages and used for the compensation. The principles of the PWM technique and the AC current calculation are explained, as well as experimental results.

description.ja: 低コスト、高効率などの利点を有する単相スイッチトリラクタンス発電機の故障時の動作を確保するため、新しい主回路構成を提案し、その有効性を実験、シミュレーションにより検証した。この方式は、回路構成をくふうし、故障した巻線を主回路から切り放すものであり、その過渡動作についても検討した。

paper_title.ja: “A Novel Control of a Current Source Active Filter for AC Power System Harmonic Compensation”
paper_title.en: A Novel Control of a Current-Source Active Filter for AC Power System Harmonic Compensation

description.en: A novel control strategy of an active power filter that consists of a current-source PWM converter and LC filters to eliminate the PWM carrier frequency components is proposed in order to obtain good harmonic compensation characteristics. The PWM converter is controlled with feedback loops of filter input currents and their derivatives to suppress the transient oscillations caused by the LC filters without inserting damping resistors. Analyzing as a sampled data system optimum values of feedback gains are investigated. The cut-off frequency of the optimum design is about one seventh of the PWM carrier frequency, and the compensation delay time is two times as large as the carrier period. The performance of the active power filter with the proposed control strategy was confirmed by experiments in which the harmonic currents generated by a phase-controlled bridge converter were compensated. Input current after compensation was essentially sinusoidal, and the harmonic content was reduced to less than 4%. © 1991 IEEE
